intro: Alternanthera peruviana f. globifera, commonly known as the globe amaranth, is a striking ornamental plant characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features dense clusters of small, colorful bracts that resemble tiny globes, giving it its common name. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it suitable for both container gardening and in-ground planting. Its foliage is often a deep red or purple, adding visual interest even when it is not in bloom.
